Thank you for the performance test. 
Cloud you try to analyze where is the bottleneck? memory, io, thread pool waiting or connection pool waiting?

Thank for you reply, my server configuration is 4U 8G(Ubentu). In normal circumstances service's memory only use 500MB, CPU used less than 10% and disk read/write go near to 0.
In order to test smoothly, I only improve the parameters of MySQL.
```
open_files_limit = 65530
innodb_open_files = 65530
table_open_cache = 65000
max_connections=30000
max_user_connections=20000
max_allowed_packet = 128M
max_prepared_stmt_count=100000
```

When I use as below command to test sharding-proxy, it will create 10 table in database and per table contain 1000000 record, then the tool will run 64 threads to connect with sharding-proxy.
```
sysbench /usr/share/sysbench/oltp_read_write.lua  --mysql-host=172.60.20.46 --mysql-port=3308 --mysql-user=root --mysql-password=root --mysql-db=sharding_db --db-driver=mysql --tables=10 --table-size=1000000 --report-interval=10 --threads=64  --time=120 --skip_trx=on  --db-ps-mode=disable --mysql-ignore-errors=1062  run;
```
In test situation, the slave service will appear larger occupancy factor. 
The disk read is 2MB/S  and write is 100KB/S.
The memory usage rate is steady keep on  1.5G
However, the CPU usage has a large fluctuation, ranging from 60% to 90%.

On other hand, the master node(write node )
The disk  write is 8MB/S, and memory usage rate has 1.6G.
Then, the CPU usage only ranging from 15% to 30%

There will be some problems with inserting duplicates during the test. I don't know if it is a test script or an sharding-proxy problem. But I saw someone fixing the bug in the issues(#1066). 

When I stop the test program, the disk read/write rate will return to 0, but  the CPU usage not recovery. And I can saw some threads in my system(slave node), unless I stop the sharding-proxy use stop.sh
![](http://ww1.sinaimg.cn/large/93d61c99ly1fu0vgptg3bj21h70mrgux.jpg)

Of course, the master node does not have such problem, and he will quickly return to the initial state after stopping the test.

I think that the threads of the salve node doesn't get release.
please remove ` proxy.transaction.mode: TCC` setting, M2 don't support transaction feature currently.

thanks for your support, waiting for your goods news.
